description.p: Natives to the Elemental Plane of Fire call their fiery home The Crematorium. Despite the aggressive reputation that fire natives receive, those who bond with fire are also known for their passion and cunning.
You gain proficiency with martial weapons, medium armor, and shields, and you can speak, read, and write Ignan.
You also gain one additional fire boon of your choice.

sheet.description: You can speak, read, and write Ignan

description.p: You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the Fire Heart Spells table. Each of these spells counts as an elementalist spell for you, but it doesnâ€™t count against the number of spells you prepare each day.

Whenever you gain an elementalist level, you can replace one spell you gained from this feature with another spell of the same level. The new spell must be a conjuration or evocation spell from the elementalist, sorcerer, warlock, or wizard spell list. Spells marked with an asterisk are Omeria Spells.

sheet.description: Whenever you gain an elementalist level, you can replace one spell you gained from this feature with another spell of the same level. The new spell must be a conjuration or evocation spell from the elementalist, sorcerer, warlock, or wizard spell list.

description.p: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, the weapon attack deals additional fire damage equal to your proficiency bonus.

sheet.description: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, the weapon attack deals additional {{proficiency}} fire damage.

description.p: When you perform an ability check or saving throw, you can grant a bonus to the result equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). If the check or saving throw already uses your Wisdom modifier, you may add it a second time. You can use this feature after you roll the die, but before the outcome is determined.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all expended uses after you complete a long rest.

sheet.description: When you perform an ability check or saving throw, you can grant a +{{wisdom:modifier}} wisdom bonus to the result. If the check or saving throw already uses your Wisdom modifier, you may add it a second time. You can use this feature after you roll the die, but before the outcome is determined.

description.p: When your elemental companions deal damage, you can choose to have them deal fire damage instead of force damage.

Also, when you take the Attack action on your turn and make an attack with a melee weapon, you can make a second attack with your elemental companions against the same target so long as your elemental companions are still active.

description.p: A halo of fire encircles your head. So long as your elemental companions are still active, whenever a hostile creature ends its turns within 5 feet of you, it takes fire damage equal to your proficiency bonus.

description.p: You gain immunity to fire damage. In addition, when you are subjected to fire damage, you take no damage and instead, you can use your reaction to regain a number of hit points equal to the fire damage you would have taken. Once you use this feature, you canâ€™t use it again until you complete a short or long rest.
